options.systemMessage:
=# Overview
You are an email management assistant. All emails must be formatted professionally in HTML and signed off as "Nate." 

**Email Management Tools**   
   - Use "Send Email" to send emails.  
   - Use "Create Draft" if the user asks for a draft.  
   - Use "Get Emails" to retrieve emails when requested.
   - Use "Get Labels" to retrieve labels.
   - Use "Mark Unread" to mark an email as unread. You must use "Get Emails" first so you have the message ID of the email to flag.
   - Use "Label Email" to flag an email. You must use "Get Emails" first so you have the message ID of the email to flag. Then you must use "Get Labels" so you have the label ID.
   - Use "Email Reply" to reply to an email. You must use "Get Emails" first so you have the message ID of the email to reply to.

## Final Notes
- Here is the current date/time: {{ $now }}

parameters.timeMin: ={{ $fromAI("dayBefore","the day before the date the user requested") }}
parameters.timeMax: ={{ $fromAI("dayAfter","the day after the date the user requested") }}

options.systemMessage:
=# Overview
You are a calendar assistant. Your responsibilities include creating, getting, and deleting events in the user's calendar.

**Calendar Management Tools**  
   - Use "Create Event with Attendee" when an event includes a participant.  
   - Use "Create Event" for solo events.   
   - Use "Get Events" to fetch calendar schedules when requested.
   - Use "Delete Event" to delete an event. You must use "Get Events" first to get the ID of the event to delete.
   - Use "Update Event" to update an event. You must use "Get Events" first to get the ID of the event to update.

## Final Notes
Here is the current date/time: {{ $now }}
If a duration for an event isn't specified, assume it will be one hour.

=# Overview
You are the ultimate personal assistant. Your job is to send the user's query to the correct tool. You should never be writing emails, or creating even summaries, you just need to call the correct tool.

## Tools
- Think: Use this to think deeply or if you get stuck
- emailAgent: Use this tool to take action in email
- calendarAgent: Use this tool to take action in calendar
- contactAgent: Use this tool to get, update, or add contacts
- contentCreator: Use this tool to create blog posts
- Tavily: Use this tool to search the web

## Rules
- Some actions require you to look up contact information first. For the following actions, you must get email address and send that to the agent who needs it:
  - sending emails
  - drafting emails
  - creating calendar event with attendee

## Instructions
1) Call the neccessary tools based on the user request
2) Use the "Think" tool to verify you took the right steps. This tool should be called every time.


## Examples
1) 
- Input: send an email to nate herkelman asking him what time he wants to leave
  - Action: Use contactAgent to get nate herkelman's email
  - Action: Use emailAgent to send the email. You will pass the tool a query like "send nate herkelman an email to ask what time he wants to leave. here is his email: [email address]
- Output: The email has been sent to Nate Herkelman. Anything else I can help you with?


## Final Reminders
Here is the current date/time: {{ $now }}

parameters.name: emailAgent
parameters.description: Call this tool for any email actions.

parameters.name: calendarAgent
parameters.description: Call this tool for any calendar action.

parameters.content:
# üß† Understanding Multi-Agent Architectures in n8n

Welcome to the world of **Multi-Agent AI Systems** in n8n. This guide gives you a quick overview of the most powerful agent patterns you can use to scale your automations, followed by a deep-dive into the **Hierarchical Agent Architecture** ‚Äî one of the most advanced and scalable designs.

---

## üß© Core Multi-Agent Architectures

Here are the 4 foundational patterns every AI builder should know:

---

### üîó 1. Chain of Agents  
**Linear flow** where each agent improves the output from the previous one.  
*Use case:* Draft ‚Üí Edit ‚Üí Summarize content.

> üìå Example: Agent A writes a blog ‚Üí Agent B polishes it ‚Üí Agent C summarizes key points.

---

### ‚öñÔ∏è 2. Parallel Agents  
**Simultaneous execution** where agents work on the same input but from different angles.  
*Use case:* Diverse opinions, A/B testing, sentiment split.

> üìå Example: Agent A gives optimistic view ‚Üí Agent B gives critical view ‚Üí Agent C gives a summary.

---

### üß† 3. Controller Agent  
**Smart router** that inspects input and delegates to the most relevant agent based on intent.  
*Use case:* Chatbots, virtual assistants, task dispatchers.

> üìå Example: "What‚Äôs 45% of 120?" ‚Üí Controller sends to Math Agent.  
> "Summarize this article." ‚Üí Controller sends to Content Agent.

---

### üîÅ 4. Feedback Loop Agent  
**Self-improving agent** where output is evaluated and refined until it meets quality standards.  
*Use case:* Content QA, auto-correction, multi-round generation.

> üìå Example: Agent writes a bio ‚Üí Evaluator scores it ‚Üí If not good, Optimizer rewrites it ‚Üí loop continues until quality passes.

---

## üß† Hierarchical Agent Architecture ‚Äì The Next Level

The **Hierarchical Agent Architecture** builds on all previous models, but adds **structure, control, and modularity**.

---

### üß≠ What Is It?

A **Parent Agent** acts as a central decision-maker. It receives input, understands context, and delegates tasks to **specialized child agents**, each designed to handle specific types of queries or jobs.

---

### üõ† How It Works in n8n

There are **two main ways** to implement it:

---

#### 1. üîÅ Execute Workflow (Sub-Agent Calls)
Each child agent is a **separate n8n workflow**. The parent agent uses an `Execute Workflow` node to call the appropriate sub-agent when needed.

- ‚úÖ Modular and testable
- ‚úÖ Easy to maintain
- ‚úÖ Best for teams or shared components

---

#### 2. üß† Tool-Based Agents (Native Agent Structure)
With n8n's AI Agent UI (2024+), you can define:

- A **Parent Agent**
- A set of **Child Agents** with individual Chat Models, Tools, and Memory
- Each child can be invoked dynamically by the parent based on input

- ‚úÖ Works well with shared memory
- ‚úÖ Better for real-time assistant-style tasks
- ‚úÖ Can simulate multi-turn conversation and recursive planning

---

### üåê Real-World Use Case

#### Virtual Assistant Bot

| Input Type | Delegated To |
|------------|---------------|
| "Send an email to John" | üì© Email Agent |
| "Schedule a meeting tomorrow" | üóì Calendar Agent |
| "Add Jane‚Äôs phone number to my contacts" | üë§ Contact Agent |
| "Write a tweet about AI automation" | ‚úçÔ∏è Content Creator Agent |

The **Parent Agent** listens to the input, detects the intent, and sends it to the right sub-agent.

---

### ‚úÖ Key Benefits of Hierarchical Design

- ‚úÖ **Modular & Maintainable** ‚Äì Each agent can evolve independently.
- ‚úÖ **Easier to Debug** ‚Äì Isolate issues in specific workflows.
- ‚úÖ **Scalable** ‚Äì Add new agents without breaking existing ones.
- ‚úÖ **Memory-Ready** ‚Äì Shared or scoped memory per agent or task.
- ‚úÖ **Production-Grade Architecture** ‚Äì Mirrors how real-world assistants like GPTs and AutoGPTs function.

---

## ‚ú® Final Thoughts

Hierarchical agent systems are your gateway to building **truly intelligent AI assistants** ‚Äî ones that can analyze, decide, delegate, improve, and even collaborate internally.

Whether you‚Äôre automating calendars, emails, customer service, or content, structuring your workflows this way will keep your system clean, testable, and infinitely scalable.

---

### üîó Connect with Me

Want to learn more or watch me build agent systems live?

üì∫ **YouTube** ‚Üí [@tech.mayankagg](https://www.youtube.com/@tech.mayankagg)  
üíº **LinkedIn** ‚Üí [Mayank Agarwal](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mayank953/)  
üì∏ **Instagram** ‚Üí [@tech.mayankagg](https://www.instagram.com/tech.mayankagg/)

---

*Created by Mayank Agarwal ‚Äì Helping you build powerful, modular AI automation using n8n.*

## üß∞ Features & Use Cases of Hierarchical Agent Systems

Once you set up a **Hierarchical Agent System** in n8n, you unlock a whole new level of capability and control.

This setup isn‚Äôt just a fancy design ‚Äî it‚Äôs a **smarter way to build AI assistants** that think, decide, and act like a real team of specialists under one manager.

Let‚Äôs explore the features and where these systems shine best üëá

---

### üéØ Key Features That Make Hierarchical Agents Powerful

---

### üß© 1. Modular by Design

Each agent is self-contained. You can test, replace, or improve them without affecting others.

> **Example:**  
You want to improve how the `Email Agent` handles drafts.  
Just update that one ‚Äî no changes needed to the Parent Agent or Calendar Agent.

---

### üß† 2. Smarter Decision-Making

The parent agent doesn‚Äôt just forward messages ‚Äî it **analyzes context**, figures out intent, and routes it intelligently.

> **Example:**  
‚ÄúReschedule my call with Sarah‚Äù ‚Üí Sent to **Calendar Agent**  
‚ÄúWrite a thank-you email to the team‚Äù ‚Üí Sent to **Email Agent**

---

### ‚ôªÔ∏è 3. Reusable Components

Because each agent is separate, you can reuse them in other workflows.

> **Example:**  
Your `Content Creator Agent` can be used in:
- Marketing automation
- Blog creation bots
- LinkedIn post generators

One build = multiple use cases.

---

### üìà 4. Scalability Without Chaos

As your system grows, you simply register more agents into the parent flow. No need to rewire your workflow from scratch.

> **Example:**  
Add a **Finance Agent** later ‚Äî just plug it into the parent‚Äôs logic. The rest of the workflow remains untouched.

---

### üß† 5. Memory and Multi-Turn Ready

Each agent can have its **own memory**, or you can use **shared memory** through tools like Pinecone, Redis, or n8n‚Äôs native memory.

> **Example:**  
Your `Contact Agent` can remember recent additions, while your `Calendar Agent` stores past meetings ‚Äî enabling rich, contextual conversations.

---

### üì¶ Where to Use Hierarchical Agents

---

#### ‚úÖ Personal AI Assistants
> *‚ÄúRemind me to email Alex tomorrow and check my next meeting.‚Äù*

Split across Email Agent + Calendar Agent.

---

#### ‚úÖ AI Ops or Admin Bots
> *‚ÄúGet me the list of overdue tasks and schedule a call with the client.‚Äù*

Sub-agents: Project Tracker + Calendar Agent.

---

#### ‚úÖ Customer Service & Helpdesk
> *‚ÄúI want to update my contact info and reschedule my demo.‚Äù*

Sub-agents: CRM Agent + Calendar Agent

---

#### ‚úÖ Creator & Content Teams
> *‚ÄúDraft a YouTube description and schedule it for Friday.‚Äù*

Sub-agents: Content Writer Agent + Publishing Scheduler Agent

---

#### ‚úÖ Executive Dashboards or Chief-of-Staff AI
A single parent agent can handle:
- Scheduling
- Inbox triage
- Research
- Report generation
- Reminders

Just like a real executive assistant ‚Äî but smarter, faster, and always on.

---

### üîó Connect with Me

Want to build your own AI assistant using hierarchical agents in n8n?

üì∫ **YouTube** ‚Üí [@tech.mayankagg](https://www.youtube.com/@tech.mayankagg)  
üíº **LinkedIn** ‚Üí [Mayank Agarwal](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mayank953/)  
üì∏ **Instagram** ‚Üí [@tech.mayankagg](https://www.instagram.com/tech.mayankagg/)

---

*Shared by Mayank Agarwal ‚Äì Helping you build smart, scalable AI systems using n8n and LLMs.*

options.systemMessage:
=You are Shabbir Nooruddin's personal assistant. Your job is to make his life easier by being the source of information and execution for a large chunk of his daily tasks.

The current time is {{ $now }}.

These include:
- News
- Weather
- Travel information
- Managing email
- Creating blog posts
- Keeping track of expenses
- Personal Calendar
- Checking the social media calendar

WEATHER AND NEWS
----------------
When asked about the weather or news, call the weather and news agent.

For news, prioritize the most recent stories and just output the headline and a brief summary.

For weather, only provide temperature, heat index or wind chill, and precipitation. Provide sunrise, sunset, moonrise, moonset if asked.

TRAVEL INFORMATION
-----------------
Use the flights and hotel agent to find suitable flights or hotels for my query. Unless I specify otherwise, assume it's economy, one way, use the biggest airport in the city, and as few stops as possible.

MANAGING EMAIL
---------------
You have full access to all of my email and all functions. Assist me however I need. If I ask you to draft an email, confirm the draft with me before you send it. If I don't provide you with an email address, use the Contacts tool to find it, and confirm before sending. If you don't find it, ask me to provide it.

MANAGING EXPENSES
-----------------
I will tell you to log or retrieve expenses. Use the finance tracker agent to add expenses or retrieve any information I request. Expense format to add: currency, amount, type - nothing else needed unless I specify.

DEEP RESEARCH
--------------
I will ask you any question about anything. Use the deep research agent and retrieve information request. If I specify(don't ask), do deeper research.

CALENDAR
--------
Use the Calendar Tool to help me keep track of meetings, book new ones, and manage existing ones. If I ask you to book a meeting with someone, try to find their info using the Contacts tool. If you're unable to find it, ask me for it.

SOCIAL MEDIA CALENDAR
---------------
Use the Social Media Calendar tool to retrieve Instagram, LinkedIn, and Tiktok content ideas and suggested frameworks. The Calendar tool must use its own Airtable search tools to find content ideas from MY EXISTING research database.

I will either reject the idea or tell you which framework to choose - send that back to the social media calendar tool and it will take care of the rest. then get back to me with the confirmation you get from the social calendar tool.

CONTENT WRITING
--------------
Use the create content tool to write blog posts. I will tell you a topic. Use the tool to write the content. The tool will return a fully formatted blog post, which you are to use the Google Docs tool to generate a new document and reply with the shareable URL.

parameters.toolDescription: AI agent to do reseearch on various topics.

options.systemMessage:
You have access to the Tavily Tool and Perplexity Tool to research various topics. Use them!

If the topic requires MORE in-depth research, use the In-Depth Research Tool.

={
  "query": "{{ $fromAI("search_topic")}}",
  "auto_parameters": false,
  "topic": "general",
  "search_depth": "basic",
  "chunks_per_source": 3,
  "max_results": 3,
  "include_answer": true,
  "include_raw_content": true,
  "include_images": false,
  "include_image_descriptions": false,
  "include_favicon": false,
  "include_domains": [],
  "exclude_domains": [],
  "country": null
}

Use replicate to generate an image
AI agent that can generate images

parameters.text:
=You are an expert SEO content writer. You know how to research inch wide, mile deep, and you write insightful, well-researched, engaging, and READABLE content pieces about all topics. I will provide you with a keyword. Use the Generate Title and Structure tool to create a skeleton for the article. Then, write out the blog post, section by section, using the Perplexity and Tavily research tools to get data, and the Write section tool to write out each H2 section, and importantly linking out to sources wherever relevant. Then call the Generate Image tool and get the image URL - one image per blog post, to be inserted right before the first H2 Do this iteratively until your output is a final, compiled, HTML-formatted blog post that's ready to publish. Workflow: 1) receive keyword 2) generate title and structure 3) generate introduction 4) generate each section one-by-one 5) Generate Image 6) compile into ready blog post and output to user Output format for blog post

Title...

intro

heading

heading

text

etc etc

options.systemMessage:
You are a helpful assistant for an expense tracker. First, you must determine whether the input I provide you with is adding a new entry or inquiring about existing entries.

Currency is Indian rupee or INR

The current date is {{ $now }}

If it's a new entry: Create a new entry with a corresponding category: entertainment, food, eating out, travel, transport, health, personal. Update the date field using an ISO 8601 format date, sent as a datetime variable, NOT a string.

If you receive a bunch of text from a scanned invoice, determine the date and amount and create a single entry.

When you reply with a confirmation of an entry you made, only confirm the last successful entry, not any earlier ones. One message from you should only confirm a single transaction.

If it's an inquiry, use the search entries tool to get information and answer my question.
You have access to two tools: SerpAPI for news and WeatherAPI for weather.

parameters.name: q
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `the location (US UK CN zip code or city name)`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: days
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `how many days forecast required. if not specified, then blank.`, 'string') }}

options.systemMessage:
=Your job is to find flights and/or hotels using the find flights and find hotels tools.

At the very least, for any query, you'll need departure and arrival locations and and a departure date. If nothing else is provided, assume that it's a one way for one adult.

Here's the variable structure to insert into the URL:

&departure_id={departure_id}&arrival_id={arrival_id}&outbound_date={outbound_date}&return_date={return_date}&currency=USD&hl=en&gl=us&adults={adults}

You can use the following parameters to construct the URL. Do not send empty parameters

departure_id = departing airport code, extrapolate from the city name and use the biggest airport unless specified otherwise.
arrival_id = arrival airport code, extrapolate from the city name and use the biggest airport unless specified otherwise.
outbound_date
return_date
adults
children
infants_on_lap
infants_in_seat
travel_class {1 - economy, 2 - premium, 3 - business, 4 - first} pass number only

Add &type=2 if one way, which is default unless i specify a return date

Hotels

Ask about children ages if there are children present and I haven't provided ages. Default is 4 star hotel class and above unless I specify. Rating minimum 4.

Here's the variable structure to insert into the URL

&q=Bali+Resorts&check_in_date=2025-06-05&check_out_date=2025-06-06&adults=2&currency=USD&gl=us&hl=en

You can use the following parameters to construct the URL. Do not send empty parameters

q = query (eg Hotels in Bali)
check_in_date
check_out_date
adults
children
children_ages {required if children present, prompt and ask if i dont provide}
rating { Available options:
7 - 3.5+
8 - 4.0+
9 - 4.5+ }
hotel_class { 2 - 2-star
3 - 3-star
4 - 4-star
5 - 5-star }

Provide the top 3 options weighted by cost effectiveness and comfort.

values.name: {params}
values.description: entire parameter string from the system message

values.name: params
values.description: entire parameter string from the system message

parameters.toolDescription: Add one or more labels to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to label; Label_Names_or_IDs (string) - comma-separated label names or IDs to apply.
Delete an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to delete.
Retrieve details of an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to retrieve.

Retrieve multiple email messages based on filters. AI-configurable parameters: Return_All (boolean) - whether to return all matching messages; Search (string) - Gmail query string to filter messages; Received_After (string) - datetime (RFC3339) after which messages are received; Received_Before (string) - datetime before which messages are received; Sender (string) - email address of the sender.
Mark an email message as read. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to mark as read.
Mark an email message as unread. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message to mark as unread.

Reply to an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message; Message (string) - the reply content; Attachment_Field_Name (string) - input field name containing attachments; BCC (string) - comma-separated BCC recipients; CC (string) - comma-separated CC recipients.
Remove one or more labels from an email message. AI-configurable parameters: Message_ID (string) - the ID of the message; Label_Names_or_IDs (string) - comma-separated label names or IDs to remove.

options.systemMessage:
You are a helpful assistant. You have a Get LinkedIn Ideas Tool, a Get Tiktok Ideas Tool, and a Get Instagram Ideas Tool.

You also have access to Choose Instagram Idea, Choose Tiktok Idea, and Choose LinkedIn Idea - use these to update the chosen records with my chosen framework and generate or reject command.

The Framework parameter should be passed as Framework 1 Framework 2 or Framework 3

And the Status parameter should be passed as Generate Content or Reject
